pr_title: Enable initial EE9 feature testing on jaxrs20 tests

timeline.bodyText: Why do we need these new permissions?  Is RESTEasy making a call that should be in a doPriv?  If so, we shouldn't add these permissions; we should add a doPriv where needed.
timeline.author: andymc12
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -8,4 +8,5 @@
     <!-- <webContainer enablemultireadofpostdata="true" /> -->
   	<include location="../fatTestPorts.xml"/>
   	<javaPermission className="java.util.PropertyPermission" name="bvt.prop.HTTP_default" actions="read"/>
+  	<javaPermission className="java.net.SocketPermission" name="*" actions="resolve"/>

replies.bodyText: I added a doPriv to address the problem and created a RestEasy jira:  https://issues.redhat.com/browse/RESTEASY-2707
replies.author: jim-krueger

timeline.bodyText: Same as above - how is the test failing with Java 2 security enabled?
timeline.author: andymc12
andymc12
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -6,4 +6,5 @@
 
   	<include location="../fatTestPorts.xml"/>
   	<javaPermission className="java.io.FilePermission" name="ALL FILES" actions="read"/>
+  	<javaPermission className="java.net.SocketPermission" name="*" actions="resolve"/>

timeline.message: Enable initial EE9 feature testing on jaxrs20 tests
Enable initial EE9 feature testing on jaxrs20 tests

timeline.bodyText:
We can't add this.  RESTEasy is licensed with Apache v2 and presumably copyrighted by RedHat, so we cannot change the license to EPL or add an IBM copyright to it.
Guess who just finished his Open Source Education! ;-)
timeline.author: andymc12
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,761 @@

replies.bodyText: I was following an example from a trusted source ;-). I'll fix it
replies.author: jim-krueger
